description: Construction of first floor to existing bungalow to be used as one self contained flat
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): MP-50/21/05A (proposed ground floor plan); MP-50/21/06A (proposed first & loft floor plan); MP-50/21/07A (proposed elevations); MP-49/21/08A (49&50 Moyne Place site plan); MP-49/21/09A (49&50 Moyne Place, front & back elevations); MP-50/21/10A (section)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D1, D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1, D3 and D4 of the London Plan(2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The residential units hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, living/dining room above bedroom of separate dwelling. The assessment and mitigation measures shall have regard to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies 1.1(j) of Ealing's Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'	 | Prior to the commencement of development, a Demolition and Construction Management and Logistics Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works on site. The plan shall include the following:
(a) A site clearance and demolition plan that sets out:

o	Noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),  An Air Quality and Dust Management Plan (AQDMP) that includes an Air Quality (Dust) Risk Assessment shall be produced in accordance with current guidance The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition, SPG, GLA, July 2014, for the existing site and the proposed development. A scheme for air pollution mitigation measures based on the findings of the report shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any works on the site.
o	Lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
o	Delivery locations,
o	Hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 Saturdays (except no work on public holidays),
o	Ensure all vehicles comply with the requirements of the London Low Emission Zone

o	Neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works, air pollutant emissions and dust for the duration of the works in case of emergency or complaint.
(b) Construction Management Plan
o	Details of construction hours; construction methods

o	Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials; Site security during construction; Site management and access; Vehicle and machinery specifications; Location, numbers and frequency of vehicles/deliveries and measures to ensure construction does not have an effect on neighbouring highways as part of a Construction Logistics Plan (CLP);

o	Control measures for noise and vibration (information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009+A1:2014 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise, BS 5228-2:2009+A1:2014)
o	Lighting (Guidance Notes for The Reduction of Light Pollution 2011 by the Institution of Lighting Professionals)
o	Construction worker parking
o	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents

o	Details of any Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) to be used in the development site shall meet as a minimum the Stage IIIB emission criteria of Directive 97/68/EC and its subsequent amendments, unless it can be demonstrated that Stage IIIB equipment is not available. An inventory of all NRMM shall be registered on the NRMM register at https://nrmm.london/user-nrmm/register. All NRMM shall be regularly serviced and service logs kept on site for inspection. Records shall be kept on site detailing proof of emissions standards for all equipment.

The Construction Logistics and Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of construction. 		 | Prior to the first occupation of the new flat hereby approved at least two (2) long-stay cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the ground floor hallway to the first floor flat and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development to encourage sustainable modes of transport in accordance with policy T5 and table 10.2 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(k) and (g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG

| Prior to first occupation of the new flat hereby approved, further details for refuse and recycling shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in wirting. The refuse storage area shall be made available for use  on first occupation and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy D6 of the London Plan (2021); policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 7A, 7.4 and 7B of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013); and (interim) SPG 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out only in conjunction with the lawful implementation of planning permission 215809FUL for the "Construction of first floor to existing bungalow to be used as one self contained flat".  No part of the first floor shall be occupied until the substantial completion of both planning permission references 215701FUL and 215809FUL.

Reason: To ensure that the character and amenity of Moyne Place are not adversely affected by the proposal, in accordance with polices D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
